description: From Latin ēnervātus, past participle of ēnervō (“to weaken”).

adjectives.description: enervate (comparative more enervate, superlative most enervate)

verbs.description: enervate (third-person singular simple present enervates, present participle enervating, simple past and past participle enervated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To reduce strength or energy; debilitate.
examples: After being laid off three times in a row, she felt too enervated to look for another job.

entries.meaning: (medicine) To partially or completely remove a nerve.
